name: Fairfield Inn & Suites Jacksonville Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited Jacksonville Beach to attend a family wedding. We found the Fairfield Inn to be comfortable with a good breakfast each morning. Across the street is the Marriott Courtyard (on the beach). As a Fairfield Inn guest we were able to use the ammenities at the Courtyard. There is plenty of parking and has easy access to the beach.
reviews.title: Comfortable Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool looked clean and many people were enjoying it. There was a computer downstairs for our use.
reviews.title: wonderful will stay again

reviews.text: We ate one night at Singletary's Seafood Shack. It really is a shack dating back 60+ years. The seafood is fresh and delicious. We ate out on the screen patio and watched the ships, boats and pelicans going by. Definitely worth the 20 minute drive.
reviews.title: Great location, great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed four nights and enjoyed the great location to the beach, restaurants and shopping. The room was great and very peaceful, considering how busy the beach traffic can be, you felt like you were away from it all. We will stay again next time we are in town, and the short walk over to the beach is perfect. There is also some real good places for pizza,hamburgers, wings, philly cheesesteak you name it. The drive from the airport was great and the hotel is very easy to find. This was a good value for the location.
reviews.title: Quiet and relaxing break

likes.disliked: — not within walking distance of good restaurants

reviews.text: My husband and I , along with our two teenage sons, stayed at the Fairfield Inn for 4 days at the end of March. The rooms were spacious and very clean. The hotel is quiet. It is a short walk to the beach, which is very nice--reminded me of Daytona beach with the large area of packed sand leading to softer sand. It appeared to be a very "family" friendly beach--in March anyway. There is a nice continental breakfast buffet (includes fresh fruit, Jimmy Dean BF sandwiches plus the usual fare)
reviews.title: Mayo Clinic patient enjoying walks on the beach

likes.liked: — right across the street from the beach without the pricetag that most hotels were carrying.
likes.disliked: — free breakfast was not very extensive.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would like to start out by saying that I am a big review reader, and they play a big part in selecting my stay at a hotel. This is the second time my husband and I have stayed at the Fairfield Inn in Jacksonville Beach, Florida. I am amazed that Expedia and the majority of websites I have visted only give this hotel 2 stars.
reviews.title: Great Stay!

reviews.text: The staff is wonderful! They are friendly and extremely helpful if you need direction.
reviews.title: excellent service!

likes.liked: — price, fast Internet (in room high speed and wireless) business printer in lobby, breakfast

reviews.text: The only bad thing about our stay here is that we could only stay one night! We stopped here on our way back from Orlando, my husband had a business meeting in Jacksonville, so my three kids and I spent the day on the beach. The hotel was lovely, nice view, the pool was just OK, but the Courtyard's pool was wonderful, and you can use it too, and it is right on the beach. My kids kept going between the pool and the beach, it was nice! The guy at the front desk could not have been more outgoing and kind, I'm pretty sure it is the same guy that was mentioned before. He gave us great dining ideas, we hate the chain restaurants so we wanted somewhere local, and it was great. The breakfast was nice with plenty of choices, everyone found something they liked. I would go back for sure, and wish we could have stayed longer. I read these reviews religiously so I hope this helps.
reviews.title: very nice and clean

likes.liked: — Proximity to the beach, front desk, free breakfast.
likes.disliked: — the small pool, but loved the courtyard's....

reviews.text: The Fairfield was great. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The service was great. You have two pools to choose from because you can also use the Courtyard's pool. The beach is great. The sand was not white, but it was soft. When the tide goes out, it leaves shallow tidal pools, great for small kids. We absolutely loved it! We will return! The Courtyard is great too, for those who want to see the beach from their room. The only room in the Fairfield that you can see the beach from is room 301, but beware, it is kind of small. The Fairfield is a great choice. I highly recommend it.
reviews.title: All around Great Choice

likes.liked: — clean rooms, great service, great beach

reviews.text: This hotel has an excellent location, only a half a block to the beach. The Courtyard hotel is across the street on the beach and they let you use their facilities.
reviews.title: Great location
INCREDIBLE SERVICE
reviews.text: The rooms are very spacious, some of them have a pull out coach for extra sleeping accomodations. Flat screen tvs, very very clean. Highly recommended.

likes.liked: — Absolutely some of the best service I've EVER had

reviews.title: Wonderful experience
reviews.text: I mostly stay at resorts on vacations, and found this hotel to be very clean, up to date, great location and very helpful, friendly staff.

I stayed at this hotel in July 2005 when it was brand new. The hotel has been well maintained. Stayed there during a business trip. Drove to downtown each morning. Since there is construction on Beach Blvd and Atlantic Blvd used Butler Blvd to 95 each day. The drive was not too bad. It was cold while we were there but it was more enjoyable than being home with 4 feet of snow. The rooms were clean. The beds were comfortable. I could not use the wireless internet in the room. The internet worked fine with the wire provided in the room. The breakfast in the morning was nice. They have Jimmy Dean Biscuit sandwiches, waffles, fruit, cereal, danish, bread, bagels, yogurt, juice and coffee. The coffee was available all day long. We did venture over to the Courtyard across the street. Very nice hotel. If you do use the beach access at the Courtyard, you need to stop at their checkin desk to obtain a key to get back in.
reviews.title: Nice hotel at the beach

reviews.text: I really enjoyed my stay at the Fairfield Inn & Suites. It was a very nice, clean, well kept hotel. I was traveling on business, but one of the things I found most interesting was that you could use all of the facilities from the Courtyard - just across the street. The Courtyard was directly on the beach. This would be a huge plus during the warmer months. The weather didn't cooperate while I was there, but it was still much nicer than at home.
reviews.title: Very Nice Stay

reviews.text: We stayed 2 nights in a Junior Suite, which is not really a suite but one large room with a wall divider between the sofa and the two double beds. I debated between the Courtyard on the beach and the Fairfield Inn, and ultimately chose Fairfield because, for a lower nightly rate, the Junior Suite is almost twice the size of a Courtyard double-double room and offers free breakfast, a sofabed and a second TV. We really did not mind the short walk to the beach, and it was great to have the extra space. Also, there is an AWESOME barbecue restaurant < 10 minutes away called Mojo Kitchen (1500 Beach Blvd) - do not miss this place! Tip for breakfast crew: we love the freshly made waffles, but please put some non-stick spray on your waffle iron! Overall I think we received good value for the rate we paid, and I would choose Fairfield Inn again the next time we need accommodations at Jax Beach.
reviews.title: Good value for families who don't mind a single (large) room

aka: Fairfield Inn And Suites Jacksonville Beach
description: This award-winning Fairfield Inn & Suites is one of the newest hotels in the First Coast area. Located within walking distance from the sandy beaches of the Atlantic Ocean, makes this hotel a great choice for any traveler. The hotel is also minutes from state parks, nightly entertainment, and local recreation. The Fairfield Inn & Suites - Jacksonville Beach is also ideal for the business traveler. Located just minutes from some of Jacksonville's largest growing business districts while still enjoying the relaxing beach lifestyle! Our hotel features 79 spacious guest rooms, and all the features to make your Jacksonville Beach vacation one to remember. Your comfort is the top priority of the hotel staff, and staying at the Fairfield Inn & Suites will be a choice that you will not regret. There is an array of features and amenities perfect for the entire family, and our proximity to the oceanfront and all of Jacksonville’s attractions will leave you with an experience unlike any other. So don’t wait any longer book your room today!
